name: Department of Labor
description: The Department of Labor fosters and promotes the welfare of job seekers, wage earners, and retirees by improving working conditions, advancing opportunities for profitable employment, and assuring work-related benefits and rights.

painPoints.point: Legacy IT systems modernization needed for unemployment insurance, workforce development, and occupational safety data management
painPoints.source: Department of Labor IT Modernization Strategy

painPoints.point: Unemployment insurance system capacity and processing improvements required to handle peak demand periods
Workforce development program data integration and reporting capabilities need enhancement
Cybersecurity and data protection for sensitive worker and employer information
Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) data collection and analysis system improvements

IT acquisition and management challenges including project delays, budget overruns, and need for improved oversight and mature acquisition practices affecting unemployment insurance and workforce IT systems
painPoints.source: GAO High-Risk List 2025 - Improving IT Acquisitions and Management

primary: Department of Labor Budget Justification FY2025 - https://www.dol.gov/agencies/oasam/centers-offices/business-operations-center/osdbu/procurement-forecast
secondary: GAO Reports on Department of Labor IT Systems

evaluationFactors: Past performance with labor or workforce systems

keyOffices: Office of the Chief Information Officer (OCIO)
Office of Small and Disadvantaged Business Utilization (OSDBU)
insights: Unemployment insurance system modernization is a major focus area
Workforce development data systems require ongoing improvements
Strong emphasis on small business participation
IT infrastructure modernization priorities across multiple programs
Data analytics and reporting capabilities are growing needs
